ETYMOLOGY: From Latin stadium, from Ancient Greek στάδιον (stádion, 'a measure of length, a race course'), likely referring to a specific length of the Olympic race track.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large building or outdoor structure with rows of seats for spectators surrounding a playing field or stage, used for sports or other public events.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个大型的、通常是露天的或有顶的建筑，设有阶梯式座位供观众围绕着比赛场地或舞台观看体育赛事或其他公共活动。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Thousands of fans packed the stadium to watch the championship match.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 数千名球迷挤满了体育场，观看冠军赛。
